ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course gives an excellent overview of current trade theory and the most important empirical approaches in international economics. I highly recomment the course for all students in international economics.

I strongly recommend this course for all students interested in trade. It gives a very good introduction in old and new trade theory and additionally leads students to the research frontier in empirical trade theory. One of the best courses I ever had, although the technical level could be higher.

I would recommend it if the topics match the interests of the student, it is not one of the courses that is enlightening or interesting for anybody. I for myself had to discover that most of the topics bored me.
I think it is very useful for students going to trade or development. Or any student that want to have a glimpse to recent work in trade.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course dida great contribution to facility access to the empirical part of trade theory.
It makes me have a more depth and broad knowledge of the different trade topics, was very useful.
